meanings.sent1: She enjoys crossbarring her windows for extra security.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will crossbar the fence to make it sturdier.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried crossbarring the tree with acorns, thinking they would hold it together.
meanings.sent4: His determination to crossbar his goals with hard work paid off in the end.
meanings.sent5: Crossbarring the shelves with metal rods prevented them from collapsing.

meanings.definition: The act of adding crossbars to something
meanings.sent1: The crossbarring of the bridge was necessary to ensure its stability.
meanings.sent2: He admired the intricate crossbarring on the old gate.
meanings.sent3: The crossbarring on the playground equipment made it look like a mini jungle gym.
meanings.sent4: The crossbarring of the bookshelf gave it a unique industrial look.
meanings.sent5: The crossbarring on the bike rack prevented bicycles from falling over.
